meanings.definition: To catch or ensnare in a net.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman tried to nett some fish in the river.
meanings.sent2: She managed to nett a butterfly in her net.
meanings.sent3: The spider decided to nett the fly for its dinner.
meanings.sent4: The basketball player tried to nett the ball in the hoop.
meanings.sent5: The hunter was able to nett a rabbit during his hunting trip.

meanings.definition: Remaining after all deductions have been made.
meanings.sent1: After all the expenses, he had a nett income of $500.
meanings.sent2: The nett amount in his bank account was higher than expected.
meanings.sent3: The nett profit from the business was surprisingly high.
meanings.sent4: She was left with a nett balance in her savings account.
meanings.sent5: The nett weight of the package was less than anticipated.

meanings.definition: To receive as profit or income.
meanings.sent1: He hoped to nett a good amount from the investment.
meanings.sent2: The company was able to nett a substantial profit this quarter.
meanings.sent3: She was excited to nett a bonus at the end of the year.
meanings.sent4: The farmer expected to nett a good harvest this season.
meanings.sent5: The author was able to nett a decent royalty from the book sales.
